spx.net

Class ImgRecvCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • spx.net.ImgRecvCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class ImgRecvCanvas
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    ImgRecvCanvas class is a component that may be added to a Java applet to display a scaled image.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paint function to draw the image to the component, with a black background. Scales the image to fit the component while maintaining the correct aspect ratio.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object.

      • setData

        public void setData(byte[] byteData,
                    int width,
                    int height,
                    int format,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int w,
                    int h)
        Set the data to be displayed in the image and force a redraw.
        Parameters:
        byteData - Data to set image to display.
        width - New total width of image.
        height - New total height of image.
        format - Data format - see spx.av.Format.
        x - X position of changed area within image.
        y - Y position of changed area within image.
        w - Width of changed area within image.
        h - Height of changed area within image.

        Enable or disable drawing of the canvas.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable, false to disable.

        public void setBlueWhenNoData(boolean blueWhenNoData)
        Set whether canvas is drawn in blue when no data is being received.
        Parameters:
        blueWhenNoData - true to draw canvas in blue.

      • getBlueWhenNoData

        public boolean getBlueWhenNoData()
        Get whether canvas is drawn in blue when no data is being received.
        Returns:
        true when canvas is drawn in blue with no data.
